revisions.rev:
{{About|the default file format used by OpenOffice.org 1|the default file format of later OpenOffice.org versions and an international standard|OpenDocument}} {{distinguish2|[[Office Open XML]], a file format developed by Microsoft}} '''OpenOffice.org XML''' is an [[open format|open]] [[XML]]-based [[file format]] developed as an open community effort{{cite web |url=http://www.openoffice.org/ |title=Welcome to the OpenOffice.org Source Project (archived website) |author=OpenOffice.org Foundation |date=2000-07-19 |accessdate=2010-08-08 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20000815055517/http://www.openoffice.org/ |archivedate = 2000-08-15}}{{cite web |url=http://www.openoffice.org/project/www/openofficefoundation.html#standards_process |title=The OpenOffice.org Project |author=OpenOffice.org Foundation |date=2000-08-10 |accessdate=2010-08-08 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20000823051154/http://www.openoffice.org/project/www/openofficefoundation.html#standards_process |archivedate=2000-08-23}}{{cite web |url=http://opendocument.xml.org/milestones |title=History of OpenDocument |date=2006-08-28 |accessdate=2010-08-08}} by [[Sun Microsystems]] and other OpenOffice.org project contributors in 2000-2002. The open-source software application suite [[OpenOffice.org]] 1.x and [[StarOffice]] 6 used the format as their native and default file format for saving files. In 2005, the OpenOffice.org (since version 2.0) and StarOffice (since version 8) have switched to a new standardized file format - '''[[OpenDocument]]''', as their native and default format.{{cite press release | title = Sun Introduces New Version of StarOffice Software | publisher = [[Sun Microsystems|Sun Microsystems, Inc.]] | date = 2005-09-27 | url = http://www.sun.com/smi/Press/sunflash/2005-09/sunflash.20050927.1.xml | accessdate = 2007-09-20 }}{{cite press release | title = OpenOffice.org 2.0 Is Here | publisher = [[OpenOffice.org]] | date = 2005-10-20 | url = http://www.openoffice.org/press/2.0/press_release.html | accessdate = 2007-09-20 }} The OpenOffice.org XML format is no longer widely used, but it is still supported in recent versions of OpenOffice.org, StarOffice and other software. OpenDocument format (ISO/IEC 26300:2006) is based on OpenOffice.org XML and these formats are very similar in many technical areas.{{cite web |url=http://xml.openoffice.org/general.html |title=OpenOffice.org XML File Format |accessdate=2010-03-27}}{{cite web |url=http://www.file-extensions.org/sxw-file-extension |title=file extension SXW - OpenOffice.org Writer document |accessdate=2010-03-27}} However, OpenDocument is not the same as the older OpenOffice.org XML format and these formats are not directly compatible. StarOffice developers and later OpenOffice.org project members adopted XML to replace the old binary StarOffice file format. The goal was to have a complete specification encompassing all StarOffice (later OpenOffice.org) components, and to provide an open standard for office documents. The draft version of OpenOffice.org XML specification was also known as ''StarOffice XML File Format''.{{citation |url=http://xml.coverpages.org/openoffice-xml_specification_draft200012.pdf |format=PDF |title=StarOffice XML File Format Working Draft, Technical Reference Manual, Draft 9, December 2000 |year=2000 |month=December |accessdate=2010-08-08}} ==File formats== The format uses [[XML]] files to describe the documents. To minimize space, the files are compressed into an archive and given a suffix depending on what sort of data is contained in them. {| class="wikitable" ! File type !! OpenOffice.org/StarOffice component !! File (template) suffixes !! MIME |- | Text || [[OpenOffice.org Writer|Writer]] || sxw (stw) || application/vnd.sun.xml.writer
application/vnd.sun.xml.writer.template{{cite web |url=http://framework.openoffice.org/documentation/mimetypes/mimetypes.html |title=Mime Content Types used in OpenOffice.org1.0 / StarOffice 4.x and later |accessdate=2010-06-05}} |- | Spreadsheet || [[OpenOffice.org Calc|Calc]] || sxc (stc) || application/vnd.sun.xml.calc
application/vnd.sun.xml.calc.template |- | Graphics || [[OpenOffice.org Draw|Draw]] || sxd (std) || application/vnd.sun.xml.draw
application/vnd.sun.xml.draw.template |- | Presentation || [[OpenOffice.org Impress|Impress]] || sxi (sti) || application/vnd.sun.xml.impress
application/vnd.sun.xml.impress.template |- | Formula || [[OpenOffice.org Math|Math]] || sxm || application/vnd.sun.xml.math |- | Master document || [[OpenOffice.org Writer|Writer]] || sxg || application/vnd.sun.xml.writer.global |- | HTML || [[OpenOffice.org Writer|Writer]] || html (stw) || text/html
application/vnd.sun.xml.writer.web |} ==Implementations== * [[Abiword]] (SXW){{cite web |url=http://www.abisource.com/wiki/PluginMatrix |title=Abiword PluginMatrix |accessdate=2010-03-27}} - free software * [[EditGrid]] Viewer (SXC){{cite web |url=http://www.editgrid.com/viewer |title=EditGrid Viewer |accessdate=2010-03-27}} - an online application * [[Gnumeric]] (SXC){{cite web |url=http://projects.gnome.org/gnumeric/doc/sect-file-open-formats.shtml |title=The file formats which Gnumeric can read |accessdate=2010-03-27}} - free software * [[Google Docs]] (SXW, import only) - an online application * [[KOffice]] (SXW, SXC, SXI) - free software * OpenOffice.org - free software * StarOffice - commercial software * [[SoftMaker Office]] 2006 - [[TextMaker]] 2006 (SXW, import only) - freeware{{cite web |url=http://www.softmakeroffice.com/ |title=SoftMaker Office 2006 for Windows |accessdate=2010-03-27}}; SoftMaker Office 2008 and newer versions are commercial software * TextMaker Viewer (SXW, view only){{cite web |url=http://www.officeviewers.com/ |title=TextMaker Viewer 2010 |accessdate=2010-03-27}} - freeware * [[Visioo-Writer]] (limited support) - free software * [[Zoho Office]] (SXW, SXC, SXI - view/edit/convert files){{cite web |url=http://sheet.zoho.com/features |title=Zoho Sheet Features |accessdate=2010-03-27}}{{cite web |url=http://writer.zoho.com/public/help/zohowriterfaq/fullpage |title=Zoho Writer - Frequently Asked Questions |accessdate=2010-03-27}}{{cite web |url=http://show.zoho.com/help/faq/faq.html |title=Zoho Show 2.0 - Frequently Asked Questions & Answers |accessdate=2010-03-27}} - an online application; Zoho Viewer (SXW, SXC, SXI - view/convert files) - online application{{cite web |url=http://viewer.zoho.com/ |title=Zoho Viewer |accessdate=2010-03-27}}{{cite web |url=http://sheet.zoho.com/excelviewer |title=Zoho Sheet - Online Excel Viewer |accessdate=2010-03-27}}; Zoho QuickRead - a Firefox/Internet Explorer plug-in for online Viewer{{cite web |url=http://writer.zoho.com/public/help/zohoquickread/fullpage |title=Zoho QuickRead |accessdate=2010-03-27}} {{See also|Comparison of word processors}} {{See also|Comparison of spreadsheets}} ==See also== * [[List of document markup languages]] * [[Comparison of document markup languages]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://xml.openoffice.org/general.html OpenOffice.org XML File Format] â File Format Specification and General Information * [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/xml/library/x-think15/ Thinking XML: The open office file format] - IBM technical library (January 1, 2003) {{Office document file formats}} {{compu-soft-stub}} [[Category:Open formats]] [[Category:Markup languages]] [[Category:Document-centric XML-based standards]] [[Category:Computer file formats]] [[de:SXW]] [[es:OpenOffice.org XML]] [[fr:SXW]] [[it:OpenOffice.org XML]] [[pl:SXW]] [[ru:OpenOffice.org XML]]
